title: CCV: Claude Code Viewer CLI Tool
description: Lightweight Go CLI that wraps claude with --output-format stream-json and renders structured text output showing assistant responses, tool calls, thinking blocks, and results. Headless CLI tool for use in scripts and automation.

title: Project setup and core type definitions
description: Initialize Go module with dependencies (bubbletea, lipgloss, bubbles). Create main.go with argument parsing. Define all SDK message type structs (SystemInit, Assistant, StreamEvent, Result, CompactBoundary). Define ContentBlock types (text, tool_use, thinking). Define ToolCall and AgentState structs.

title: Search tool renderers (Glob/Grep)
description: Implement text formatters for Glob/Grep search tools. Glob should show: '→ Glob: <pattern>' followed by file paths found. Grep should show: '→ Grep: <pattern>' followed by matches with file:line format. Keep output scannable.

title: Agent hierarchy renderer
description: Implement text formatter for showing agent hierarchy and context. Display current agent type and status inline (e.g., '[main: running]' or '[task: exploring]'). Show nesting with indentation when sub-agents are spawned via Task tool. Keep display compact and informative.

title: Final result summary renderer
description: Implement final result summary formatter. Shows session completion with: total tokens used, cost, duration, number of turns. Format as a summary block at the end. Include breakdown of input/output/cache tokens.

title: Integration testing and build setup
description: Build commands in Makefile. Test with simple prompts. Test with subagent prompts. Verify permission prompt forwarding works. Cross-compile for macOS, Linux, Windows.

title: README with curl one-liner installation
description:
Create a comprehensive README.md that includes:

## Requirements
- One-liner curl installation: `curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/REPO/main/install.sh | bash`
- Installation script (install.sh) that:
  - Detects OS (macOS, Linux)
  - Detects architecture (amd64, arm64)
  - Downloads the appropriate binary from GitHub releases
  - Installs to /usr/local/bin (or ~/.local/bin)
  - Verifies checksums

## README Content
- Project description and features
- Installation section with multiple methods:
  - One-liner curl install (recommended)
  - Go install: `go install github.com/REPO/cmd/ccv@latest`
  - Manual binary download
  - Build from source
- Usage examples
- Configuration options
- Requirements (claude CLI must be installed)
- Screenshots/demos (optional GIF)
- Contributing section
- License

title: Remove Bubble Tea TUI dependencies and code
description: Remove all Bubble Tea (bubbletea, lipgloss) dependencies from go.mod. Delete tui.go file. Refactor main.go to remove tea.NewProgram() and all TUI initialization code. The goal is to make ccv a headless CLI that outputs structured text to stdout instead of an interactive TUI.

title: Implement headless structured text output processor
description: Create a new text output processor that consumes messages from runner.messages channel and outputs formatted text to stdout. Should display: assistant text responses, thinking blocks (with [THINKING] prefix), tool calls (with tool name and status), tool results (indented), and token usage summary. Output should be clean, readable, and suitable for logging/piping.

title: Add output formatting flags
description: Add CLI flags to control output verbosity: --verbose (show all details including tool inputs), --quiet (only show assistant text), --format (text|json). Default should be structured text with moderate detail. JSON format should output the parsed SDK messages as clean JSON.

title: Claude subprocess runner and JSON stream parser
description: Create subprocess runner that spawns claude with injected flags (--output-format stream-json --include-partial-messages). Handle stdout/stderr/stdin piping. Forward stdin for permission prompts. Implement NDJSON line-by-line parser. Type detection and unmarshaling for each message type.

title: Bubble Tea model and core UI structure
description: Create main Bubble Tea model with state. Implement Init(), Update(), View() methods. Define Lip Gloss styles (colors, borders, spacing). Handle terminal resize events. Connect parser output to UI messages via channels.

title: Application state management
description: Implement AppState with agent tracking. Track tool calls by ID in PendingTools map. Build agent hierarchy from parent_tool_use_id field. Track token counts across all agents. Manage streaming state (partial text, partial tool input).

title: Token-counting spinner component
description: Token-counting spinner with animation using bubbles spinner. Show current agent context. Update token count from usage data in assistant messages. Handle start/stop states.

title: Generic tool call renderer
description: Implement text formatter for generic tool calls. Should output tool name, input parameters (formatted as readable text or JSON), and status (pending/running/completed/failed). Format: '→ Tool: <name> [<status>]' followed by indented parameters.

title: Bash tool output renderer
description: Implement text formatter for Bash tool calls and results. Should show the command being executed and the output. Format: '→ Bash: <command>' followed by indented stdout/stderr output. Preserve ANSI colors if present.

title: File operation renderers (Read/Write)
description: Implement text formatters for Read/Write file operations. Read should show: '→ Read: <file_path>' with line count. Write should show: '→ Write: <file_path>' with size or line count. Keep output concise.

title: Edit/MultiEdit diff renderer
description: Implement text formatter for Edit/MultiEdit operations showing diffs. Format: '→ Edit: <file_path>' followed by a unified diff-style output showing old vs new content. Use +/- prefixes for added/removed lines. Keep diffs readable and concise.
